intro: Acianthera hirtzii, commonly known as the hairy acianthera, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, hairy textures, which help in reducing water loss. Acianthera hirtzii is a terrestrial orchid that requires well-drained soil and indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
